title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: new 2021 IYCF indicator guideline, 7 indicators related breastfeeding practices list . article demonstrate riycf package can apply calculating indicators steps--step approach. Ever Breastfeed (EvBF) Early Initiation Breastfeeding (EIBF) Exclusive Breastfeed First Two Days Birth (BEF2D) Exclusive Breastfeeding Six Months (EBF) Mixed Milk Feeding Six Months (MixMF) Continuous Breastfeeding 12-23 Months (CBF) Bootle Feeding 0-23 Months (BoF)

title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: Firstly, load required libraries data analysis work. use riycf package IYCF indicator generation work. guideline demonstration, use sample dataset provided CARE Myanmar team IYCF modules. detailed description variable’s name variable labels mentioned documentation. Use following syntax check dataset description. dataset contains 359 observations 46 variables, variables organized based IYCF sample questionnaire. tried mention explicitly matching function inputs parameters question numbers IYCF sample question. dataset variables sample one, please apply relevant ones respective input parameter.
code: library(riycf) ?iycfData  df <- iycfData head(df[1:5]) #>   csex calc_age_months child_bf child_eibf child_eibf_hrs #> 1    1               5        1          0             NA #> 2    1               4        1          0             NA #> 3    1               2        1          0             NA #> 4    1               0        1          0             NA #> 5    1               2        1          0             NA #> 6    1               2        1          0             NA

title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: According definition, proportion 2 years old children (< 24 months) ever breastfed. Therefore, indicator accounts 2 years old children, children outside age range include indicator calculation. get indicator, use get_evbf() function follows. need two input parameters calculate indicator; child age month child ever breastfed (Questions 1 IYCF questionnaires). can also check whether correct using manual data checking. 153 2 years old children available sample dataset. Among , 108 breastfeeding, 45 didn’t. Therefore, get_evbf() function yields result manual check, can go ahead use reporting purposes.
code: df$evbf <- get_evbf(q4 = df$child_bf,                      age = df$calc_age_months) table(df$evbf) #>  #>   0   1  #>   8 145 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24)) #> [1] 153 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24 & df$child_bfyest == 1)) #> [1] 108 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24 & df$child_bfyest == 0)) #> [1] 45

title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: early breastfeeding initiation accounts children 2 years old put breast within one hour birth. need three parameters calculate indicator using get_eibf() function. , according indicator definition, allowed two conditions determine EIBF; put immediately breast within one hour. Although information asked one question (Question 2 IYCF sample questionnaires), response normally recorded three categories; one immediately, one recording hours, days. use first two variables related question number 2 (immediately hours record) function. Look use function. , make manual checking whether result got get_eibf() correct . 102 children met indicator definition conditions, 33 , 8 observations missing information variable required q2 argument.
code: df$eibf <- get_eibf(age = df$calc_age_months,                      q2 = df$child_eibf,                      q2_hour = df$child_eibf_hrs) table(df$eibf) #>  #>   0   1  #>  33 102 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24 & (df$child_eibf == 0 | df$child_eibf_hrs == 0))) #> [1] 102 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24 & df$child_eibf != 0 & df$child_eibf_hrs != 0)) #> [1] 33 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24 & is.na(df$child_eibf))) #> [1] 8

what: Exclusive Breastfeed For The First Two Days After Birth (BEF2D)
title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: indicator count 2 years old children breastfed exclusively first two days birth. , exclusively breastfeeding condition taken mother caregiver’s self-reported answer, like calculation standard exclusive breastfeeding indicator (calculate following topic) calculation using different liquid solid food recall variables. use get_ebf2d() function one. requires two input parameters, age Question 3 IYCF sample questionnaires - capture information children exclusively breastfed first two days life. manual check get_ebf2d() function got result.
code: df$ebf2d <- get_ebf2d(q3 = df$bf_2days,                        age = df$calc_age_months) table(df$ebf2d) #>  #>   0   1  #>  50 103 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24 & df$bf_2days == 0)) #> [1] 103 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24 & df$bf_2days == 1)) #> [1] 50

previous_headings: Breastfeeding Indicator Calculation > Exclusive Breastfeeding Under Six Months (EBF)
title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: First, need calculate liquid food consumption status 24 hours diet recall IYCF questionnaires. calculation, can use get_dummy() function include food items variables get respective liquid solid (semi-solid) food consumption status. child receives food items inputs foods items, function return 1, , 0. sample code get dummy variables calculate liquid consumption status. used liquid recall questions input parameters calculation (Question 6A Question 6J IYCF sample questionnaires). Whoever received liquids input parameters score 1 0. Please note input parameter get_dummy() function list type. need create list liquid variables can include analysis first apply list get_dummy() function calculate dummy variable, indicates whether child received liquid previous day.
code: liquid <- list(df$child_vitdrop, df$child_ors, df$child_water, df$child_juice,                 df$child_broth, df$child_porridge, df$child_bms, df$child_milk,                 df$child_mproduct, df$child_liquid)  df$liquid_food <- get_dummy(var_list = liquid) table(df$liquid_food) #>  #>   0   1  #>  24 138

previous_headings: Breastfeeding Indicator Calculation > Exclusive Breastfeeding Under Six Months (EBF)
title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: solid semi-food consumption status, used variables 24 hours solid (semi-solid) food recall Question 7A Question 7R IYCF questionnaires. child got food list, indicated 1, /didn’t, 0.
code: solid <- list(df$child_rice, df$child_potatoes, df$child_pumpkin,                df$child_beans, df$child_leafyveg, df$child_mango, df$child_fruit,                df$child_organ, df$child_beef, df$child_fish, df$child_insects,                df$child_eggs, df$child_yogurt, df$child_fat, df$child_plam,                df$child_sweets, df$child_condiments)  df$solid_food <- get_dummy(var_list = solid) table(df$solid_food) #>  #>   0   1  #>  31 131

previous_headings: Breastfeeding Indicator Calculation > Exclusive Breastfeeding Under Six Months (EBF)
title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: Now, got input parameters required EBF indicator calculation. get_ebf() function identify children exclusively breastfed previous day, means got breastmilk liquid solid food feedings. can also cross-check result manual calculation syntax. dataset 40 6 months children, among , 15 exclusively breastfed.
code: df$ebf <- get_ebf(q4 = df$child_bfyest,                    age = df$calc_age_months,                    liquid_food = df$liquid_food,                    solid_food = df$solid_food) table(df$ebf) #>  #>  0  1  #> 25 15 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 6)) #> [1] 40 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 6 & df$child_bfyest == 1 &                 df$liquid_food == 0 & df$solid_food == 0)) #> [1] 15

what: Mixed Milk Feeding Under Six Months (MixMF)
title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: indicator count 6 months old children received formula /animal milk addition breastmilk previous day. can use get_mixmf() function calculate indicator. According definition, need four parameters; age, breastfeeding status, infant formula (Question 6B), animal milk (Question 6C) consumption status previous day. manual calculation checking get_mixmf() function result. 40 6 months old children, 3 children get mixed milk feeding.
code: df$mixmf <- get_mixmf(q4 = df$child_bfyest,                        age = df$calc_age_months,                        q6b = df$child_bms,                        q6c = df$child_milk) table(df$mixmf) #>  #>  0  1  #> 37  3 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 6 & df$child_bfyest == 1 &                 (df$child_bms == 1 | df$child_milk ==  1))) #> [1] 3

title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: continuous breastfeeding indicator accounts age range 12-23 months. Children age range consider indicator calculation. use get_cbf() function, requires two input parameters; child age breastfeeding status previous day. 64 children 12-23 months old, 33 continuously breastfed one year age. manual calculation syntax, see got results get_cbf() function .
code: df$cbf <- get_cbf(q4 = df$child_bfyest,                    age = df$calc_age_months) table(df$cbf) #>  #>  0  1  #> 31 33 length(which(df$calc_age_months >= 12 & df$calc_age_months < 24)) #> [1] 64 length(which(df$calc_age_months >= 12 & df$calc_age_months < 24 &                 df$child_bfyest == 1)) #> [1] 33

title: Breastfeeding Indicators
text: last indicator breastfeeding session, counts children (2 years old) received bottle feeding previous day. get_bof() function, can calculate indicator require two input parameters; child age bottle feeding status (Question 5). Among 153 2 years old children, 24 fed bottle nipple previous day.
code: df$bof <- get_bof(q5 = df$bf_bottle,                    age = df$calc_age_months) table(df$bof) #>  #>   0   1  #> 127  26 length(which(df$calc_age_months < 24 & df$bf_bottle == 1)) #> [1] 26

what: Introduction Of Solid, Semi-solid Or Soft Foods 6-8 Months (ISSSF)
title: Complementary Feeding Indicators - Other
text: introduction semi-solid food indicator accounts 6-8 months old children receive solid (semi-solid food) previous day. , don’t use self-reported variable “number meal frequency” feeding calculation. Instead, use dietary recall variables IYCF sample question Question 7A Question 7R. children received one food items questions, children considered introduced solid, semi-solid, soft food (ISSF). Use get_dummy function create dummy variable solid food consumption solid food diet recall questions. , use get_isssf function get number children meet indicator definition .
code: solid <- list(df$child_rice, df$child_potatoes, df$child_pumpkin, df$child_beans,                df$child_leafyveg, df$child_mango, df$child_fruit, df$child_organ,                df$child_beef, df$child_fish, df$child_insects, df$child_eggs,                df$child_yogurt,  df$child_fat, df$child_plam, df$child_sweets,                df$child_condiments)  df$solid_food <- get_dummy(var_list = solid) df$isssf <- get_isssf(solid_food = df$solid_food,                        age = df$calc_age_months) table(df$isssf) #>  #>  0  1  #>  3 24

what: Egg And/Or Flesh Food Consumption 6-23 Months (EFF)
title: Complementary Feeding Indicators - Other
text: Another indicator related complementary feeding EFF, accounts 6-23 months children get eggs /flesh food previous day. can use get_dummy create dummy variable indicate got food . According guideline, following questions considered sweet beverage foods category. Question 7I: Liver, kidney, heart Question 7J: Sausages, hot dogs, ham, bacon, salami, canned meat Question 7K: meat, beef, pork, lamb, goat, chicken, duck Question 7L: Eggs Question 7M: Fresh fish, dried fish shellfish , using get_eff calculate EFF indicator using dummy variable created child age variable.
code: egg_meat <- list(df$child_organ, df$child_beef, df$child_fish, df$child_insects, df$child_eggs)  df$egg_meat <- get_dummy(var_list = egg_meat) df$eff <- get_eff(egg_meat = df$egg_meat,                    age = df$calc_age_months) table(df$eff) #>  #>  0  1  #> 38 75

text: Four different types iycf-XLS forms available based user application purpose, user can select appropriate iycf-XLS form. general, iycf-XLS forms can categorized two; Household Survey IYCF modules IYCF module XLS form. category, two types iycf-XLS form provided based food questions administration guideline. Ask respondent different time meal child ate yesterday (morning child wake-night child goes sleep). + List-Based Questionnaires Foods: approach directly asks individual food group mentioned food consumption questions. approaches contain questions, difference display format customized based questionnaire`s administration purpose. information two approaches, please go IYCF indicator guideline, page 28. download IYCF XLS forms, please go Github repository.

title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators
text: article mainly demonstrate riycf package’s function can apply calculating minimum diet-related indicators. According new 2021 guideline, four types complementary feeding practice indicators related minimum diet requirements; Minimum Dietary Diversity 6-23 Months (MDD), Minimum Meal Frequency 6-23 Months (MMF), Minimum Milk Feeding Frequency Non-Breastfed Children 6-23 Months (MMFF) Minimum Acceptable Diet.

title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators

title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators
text: Calculation MDD included three main steps: (1) identification food groups consumed children 6-23 months age previous days, (2) calculation total number food groups (total 8 food groups) consumed previous day (3) identification children meet minimum requirement food groups (least 5 food groups) previous day’s consumption.

previous_headings: Minimum Diet Related Indicators > Minimum Dietary Diversity 6-23 Months (MDD)
what: Individual food group consumption: dummy variables
title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators
text: first step MDD, now identify food group children consumed previous day. use get_dummy function generate dummy variable 8 food groups: breast milk; grains, white/pale starchy roots, tubers plantains; beans, peas, lentils, nuts seeds; dairy products (milk, infant formula, yogurt, cheese); flesh foods (meat, fish, poultry, organ meats); eggs; vitamin -rich fruits vegetables; fruits vegetables. Please note input parameter get_dummy function list, vector. need prepare list variables food items like include food group dummy variable calculation. article, used variables applied 2021 IYCF indicators guideline. detailed description input variables used food group calculation can checked using following syntax sample dataset description file. breastfeeding dummy variable, guideline-recommended using Question  4: breastfed yesterday day night. grains-related food groups, including grains, white/pale starchy roots, tubers plantains, used Question 7B Question 7D IYCF sample questionnaires. pulses food groups include beans, peas, lentils, nuts, seeds, need use one variable, Question 7N. dairy products food group, following foods items included; milk, infant formula, yogurt, cheese) following questions guidelines provide information; Question 6B, Question 6C, Question 6D, Question 7A, Question 7O. information flesh foods, meat, fish, poultry, organ meats, available following four questions guideline; Question 7I, Question 7J, Question 7K, Question 7M. one variable requires Eggs food group, Question 7L. use following questions guideline calculating vitamin -rich fruits vegetables; Question 7C, Question 7E, Question 7G. used following two variables fruits vegetable food groups; Question 7F Question 7H.
code: ?iycfData df$breastmilk <- get_dummy(var_list = list(df$child_bfyest)) df$grains <- get_dummy(var_list = list(df$child_rice, df$child_potatoes)) df$pulses <- get_dummy(var_list = list(df$child_beans)) dairy_list <- list(df$child_bms, df$child_milk, df$child_mproduct, df$child_yogurt, df$child_yogurt)  df$dairy <- get_dummy(var_list = dairy_list) meat_list <- list(df$child_organ, df$child_insects,  df$child_beef, df$child_fish)  df$meat <- get_dummy(var_list = meat_list) df$eggs <- get_dummy(var_list = list(df$child_eggs)) vita_fruveg_list <- list(df$child_pumpkin, df$child_leafyveg, df$child_mango)  df$vita_fruveg <- get_dummy(var_list = vita_fruveg_list) df$oth_fruveg <- get_dummy(var_list = list(df$child_fruit, df$child_fruit))

title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators
text: Unlike MDD, MMF requires complex criteria, depend children breastfeeding status age range. need four essential information calculate indicator; child age, breastfeeding status, meal frequency, milk (beside breastmilk) feeding frequency.

previous_headings: Minimum Diet Related Indicators > Minimum Meal Frequency 6-23 Months (MMF)
title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators
text: minimum meal frequency breastfeeding varies child’s age. requires least two meals 6-8 months old children, least three times children 9-23 months old. sample syntax using three functions calculate minimum meal frequency breastfeeding children. get_mmf_bf_6to8 - calculate minimum meal frequency 6-8 months old breastfed children get_mmf_bf_9to23 - calculate minimum meal frequency 6-8 months old breastfed children get_mmf_bf - calculate minimum meal frequency 6-8 months old breastfed children
code: # BF 6-8 months  df$mmfbf_6to8 <- get_mmf_bf_6to8(q4 = df$child_bfyest,                                   q8 = df$child_food_freq,                                   age = df$calc_age_months) table(df$mmfbf_6to8) #>  #>  0  1  #>  7 14  # BF 9-23 months  df$mmfbf_9to23 <- get_mmf_bf_9to23(q4 = df$child_bfyest,                                     q8 = df$child_food_freq,                                     age = df$calc_age_months)  table(df$mmfbf_9to23) #>  #>  0  1  #> 24 28  # Overall BF df$mmf_bf <- get_mmf_bf(mmfbf_6to8 = df$mmfbf_6to8,                          mmfbf_9to23 = df$mmfbf_9to23) table(df$mmf_bf) #>  #>  0  1  #> 31 42

title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators
text: MMF calculation non-breastfeeding children, need consider number milk feeds meal frequency. get , use get_nonbf_frq function calculate milk & meal feeding frequency using following questions; Question 6Bnum: infant formula feeding frequency, Question 6Cnum: animal milk feeding frequency, Question 6Dnum: milk-product liquid feeding frequency Question 8: meal frequency. , calculate minimum meal frequency 6-23 months non-breastfeeding children using milk & meal frequency information calculate . Whoever gets least 4-times milk meal frequency previous identified children get minimum meal frequency non-breastfed children. Use get_mmf_nonbf function calculate indicator sample syntax provided .
code: df$nonbf_frq <- get_nonbf_frq(q6bnum = df$child_bms_freq,                                q6cnum = df$child_milk_freq,                                q6dnum = df$child_mproduct_freq,                                q8 = df$child_food_freq)  table(df$nonbf_frq) #> < table of extent 0 > sum(df$nonbf_frq) #> [1] NA df$mmf_nonbf <- get_mmf_nonbf(q4 = df$child_bfyest,                                 q8 = df$child_food_freq,                                nonbf_frq = df$nonbf_frq,                                age = df$calc_age_months) table(df$mmf_nonbf) #> < table of extent 0 >

what: Minimum Milk Feeding Frequency For Non-Breastfed Children 6-23 Months (MMFF)
title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators
text: minimum milk feeding frequency indicator non-breastfeeding children. requires two-stage calculations; (1) calculating milk feeding frequency score (2) calculating MMFF indicator. package, can use get_milk_frq function get score, following input information required score; Question 6Bnum: infant formula feeding frequency, Question 6Cnum: animal milk feeding frequency, Question 6Dnum: milk product liquid feeding frequency, Question 7Anum: milk-product solid food feeding frequency. Whoever 6-23 months old non-breastfed children get least two milk feeds previous day considered minimally milk-fed children. Use get_mmff function calculate indicator, requires two input parameters; age milk feeding frequency score.
code: df$milk_frq <- get_milk_frq(q6bnum = df$child_bms_freq,                              q6cnum = df$child_milk_freq,                              q6dnum = df$child_mproduct_freq,                              q7anum = df$child_yogurt) table(df$milk_frq) #> < table of extent 0 > sum(df$milk_frq) #> [1] NA df$mmff <- get_mmff(q4 = df$child_bfyest,                      age = df$calc_age_months,                      milk_frq = df$milk_frq) table(df$mmff) #> < table of extent 0 >

title: Minimum Diet Related Indicators
text: Using information calculated article; minimum dietary diversity, minimum meal frequency, minimum milk frequency non-breastfeed children. Whoever 6-23 months old children meet following condition identified children get minimum acceptable diet; + get minimum dietary diversity, + get minimum meal frequency (breastfed non-breastfed), + get breastfed get minimum milk feeding frequency. use get_mad function calculate MAD indicator, sample syntax provided .
code: df$mad <- get_mad(age = df$calc_age_months,                    q4 = df$child_bfyest,                    mdd = df$mdd,                    mmf = df$mmf,                    mmff = df$mmff) table(df$mad) #>  #>  0  1  #> 61 12

title: Utilities for Calculating Infant and Young Child Feeding Indicators
text: first 1,000 days life (pregnancy child’s 2nd birthday) critical addressing childhood malnutrition, especially stunting. Infant young child feeding practices (IYCF) largely overlap period cover breastfeeding complementary feeding practices first two years child’s life. also significant impact childhood health, nutrition outcomes, child survival. , therefore, critical countries measure IYCF practices part efforts monitor progress toward Sustainable Development Goal 2. also important development agencies able monitor evaluate programs aimed improving infant young child feeding practices towards improved overall childhood nutrition. UNICEF released first IYCF indicators definition measurement guidelines 2008. 2021, guidelines updated along revised standard questionnaire capture information required calculate updated IYCF indicators since first initial publication. general, IYCF indicators can categorized three main categories: (1) breastfeeding indicators, (2) complementary indicators, (3) indicators.

title: Utilities for Calculating Infant and Young Child Feeding Indicators
text: Although initial measurement guidelines published 2008 many humanitarian organisations country health ministries implementing indicators, comprehensive statistical programming package calculate indicators yet available. Therefore, every time researchers (humanitarian organisations) required collect analyse, need considerable amount time recode syntax (depending statistical program using). time-consuming work. riycf package aims address technical gap providing easy--use package functions calculate IYCF indicators provided guidelines. include comprehensive guidelines step--step usage automated function analyse individual IYCF indicators using R.

code: df <- iycfData  # Liquid consumption previous day - yes/no  liquid <- list(df$child_vitdrop, df$child_ors, df$child_water,                 df$child_juice, df$child_broth, df$child_porridge,                 df$child_bms, df$child_milk, df$child_mproduct,                 df$child_liquid) #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_vitdrop`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_ors`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_porridge`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_liquid`.   df$liquid_food <- get_dummy(var_list = liquid)   # Solid food consumption previous day - yes/no  solid <- list(df$child_rice, df$child_potatoes, df$child_pumpkin,                df$child_beans, df$child_leafyveg, df$child_mango,                df$child_fruit, df$child_organ, df$child_beef, df$child_fish,                df$child_insects, df$child_eggs, df$child_yogurt,                df$child_fat, df$child_plam, df$child_sweets,                df$child_condiments) #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_insects`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_fat`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_plam`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_condiments`.   df$solid_food <- get_dummy(var_list = solid)   # Child exclusively breastfed ebf <- get_ebf(df$child_bfyest, df$calc_age_months, df$liquid_food,                df$solid_food)

title: Construct the food groups consumption score (from Minimum Dietary Diversity 6-23 months (MDD)) — get_foodscore
code: # Individual Food Group Variable Construction   df <- iycfData  # General Dummy variable generator function  breastmilk <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 1), 0)  grains <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 1), 0)  pulses <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 1), 0)  dairy <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 1), 0)  meat <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 1), 0)  eggs <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 1), 0)  vita_fruveg <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 1), 0)  oth_fruveg <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 1), 0)   # Calculate Food Consumption Score  food_score <- get_foodscore(breastmilk, grains, pulses, dairy, meat,                              eggs, vita_fruveg, oth_fruveg)

title: Determining Minimum Acceptable Diet — get_mad
text: Identification individual 6-23 months old children minimum acceptable diet based breastfeeding status Identification individual 6-23 months old children dietary practices meet minimum requirement dietary diversity (least 5 food group 8 food groups)

title: Determining Minimum Acceptable Diet — get_mad
code: get_mad(age, q4, mdd, mmf, mmff)  get_mdd(food_score, age)

title: Determining Minimum Acceptable Diet — get_mad
text: age parameter holds information child age month format. q4 binary variable mentions child receiving breastfeeding previous day (yes = "1", = "0"). mdd binary variable holds whether child received minimum dietary diversity  (yes = "1", = "0"). mmf binary variable indicates child got minimum meal frequency ("1") ("0"). mmff parameter non-breastfed children received minimum milk feeding frequency (yes = "1", = "0"). food_score integer variable continuous scale indicates number food groups child consumed previous day

title: Determining Minimum Acceptable Diet — get_mad
code: df <- iycfData   df$mdd <- rbinom(n = nrow(df), size = 1, prob = 0.5)   df$mmf <- rbinom(n = nrow(df), size = 1, prob = 0.5)   df$mmff <- rbinom(n = nrow(df), size = 1, prob = 0.5)    mad <- get_mad(df$calc_age_months, df$child_bfyest, df$mdd, df$mmf, df$mmff)    # Minimum Dietary Diversity   df <- iycfData    df$food_score <- round(runif(nrow(df), min = 0, max = 8), 0)    mdd <- get_mdd(df$food_score, df$calc_age_months)

code: get_mmf(mmf_bf, mmf_nonbf)  get_mmf_bf(mmfbf_6to8, mmfbf_9to23)  get_mmf_bf_6to8(q4, q8, age)  get_mmf_bf_9to23(q4, q8, age)  get_mmf_nonbf(q4, q8, nonbf_frq, age)  get_nonbf_frq(q6bnum, q6cnum, q6dnum, q8)

title: Determining Minimum Meal Freq — get_mmf
text: mmf_bf binary variable indicates overall breastfed child received minimum meal frequency . mmf_nonbf binary variable indicates overall non-breastfed child received minimum meal frequency . mmfbf_6to8 binary variable indicates 6-8 months breastfed child received minimum meal frequency . mmfbf_9to23 binary variable indicates 9-23 months breastfed child received minimum meal frequency . q4 binary variable mentioned child received breastfeeding previous day (yes = "1", = "0"). q8 integer variable continuous scale indicates number meals (solid, semi-solid soft foods) child ate yesterday. age parameter holds information child age month format. nonbf_frq integer variables continuous scale presents frequency non-Breastfed child meal including milk feeding. q6bnum parameter indicates number infant formula feeding children received previous days. q6cnum parameter holds information frequency milk related food feeding child received yesterday (milk animals, fresh, tinned, powdered milk) q6dnum parameter presents information frequency yogurt drinks child received previous day.

title: Determining Minimum Meal Freq — get_mmf

text: Nicholus Tint Zaw

title: Determining Minimum Meal Freq — get_mmf
code: # Minimum Meal Frequency    df <- iycfData    # breastfeeding children   mmfbf_6to8 <- get_mmf_bf_6to8(df$child_bfyest,                                 df$child_food_freq,                                 df$calc_age_months)   mmfbf_9to23 <- get_mmf_bf_9to23(df$child_bfyest,                                   df$child_food_freq,                                   df$calc_age_months)    mmf_bf <- get_mmf_bf(mmfbf_6to8, mmfbf_9to23)    # non-breastfeeding children   nonbf_frq <- get_nonbf_frq(df$child_bms_freq,                              df$child_milk_freq,                              df$child_mproduct_freq,                              df$child_food_freq)    mmf_nonbf <- get_mmf_nonbf(df$child_bfyest,                              df$child_food_freq,                              nonbf_frq,                              df$calc_age_months)     # all children   mmf <- get_mmf(mmf_bf, mmf_nonbf)

code: df <- iycfData  # Ever Breastfed evbf <- get_evbf(df$child_bf, df$calc_age_months)  # Early Initiation of Breastfeeding eibf <- get_eibf(df$calc_age_months, df$child_eibf, df$child_eibf_hrs)  # Exclusive Breastfeeding for the first two days after birth df$q3 <- rbinom(n = nrow(df), size = 1, prob = 0.5)  ebf2d <- get_ebf2d(df$q3, df$calc_age_months)  # Mixed Milk Feeding Under 6 months mixmf <- get_mixmf(df$child_bfyest, df$calc_age_months,                    df$child_bms, df$child_milk)  # Continuous Breastfeeding 12-23 months cbf <- get_cbf(df$child_bfyest, df$calc_age_months)  # Bottle Feeding 0-23 months df$q5 <- rbinom(n = nrow(df), size = 1, prob = 0.5)  bof <- get_bof(df$q5, df$calc_age_months)

text: Nicholus Tint Zaw

title: Construct other breastfeeding related indicators (from IYCF) — get_isssf
code: df <- iycfData  # Introduction of Solid, Semi-solid or soft foods (6-8 months) # Solid food consumption previous day - yes/no  solid <- list(df$child_rice, df$child_potatoes, df$child_pumpkin,                df$child_beans, df$child_leafyveg, df$child_mango,                df$child_fruit, df$child_organ, df$child_beef, df$child_fish,                df$child_insects, df$child_eggs, df$child_yogurt,                df$child_fat, df$child_plam, df$child_sweets,                df$child_condiments) #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_insects`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_fat`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_plam`. #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_condiments`.   df$solid_food <- get_dummy(var_list = solid)   isssf <- get_isssf(df$solid_food, df$calc_age_months)   # Egg and/or Flesh food consumption (6-23 months) # Egg and/or Flesh food consumption previous day - yes/no  egg_meat <- list(df$child_organ, df$child_beef, df$child_fish,                   df$child_insects, df$child_eggs) #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_insects`.   df$egg_meat <- get_dummy(var_list = egg_meat)   eff <- get_eff(df$egg_meat, df$calc_age_months)  # Sweet beverage consumption (6-23 months) # Sweet beverage consumption previous day - yes/no  sweet <- list(df$child_milk_sweet, df$child_mproduct_sweet,                df$child_chocolate, df$child_juice, df$child_soda,                df$child_tea_sweet, df$child_oth_drink_swee) #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_oth_drink_swee`.   df$sweet <- get_dummy(var_list = sweet)   swb <- get_swb(df$sweet, df$calc_age_months)  # Unhealthy food consumption (6-23 months) # Unhealthy food consumption previous day - yes/no  unhealthy <- list(df$child_sweets, df$child_condiments) #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `child_condiments`.   df$unhealthy <- get_dummy(var_list = unhealthy)   ufc <- get_ufc(df$unhealthy, df$calc_age_months)  # Zero vegetable or fruit consumption (6-23 months) # Zero vegetable or fruit consumption previous day - yes/no  vege_fruit <- list(df$child_pumpkin, df$child_leafyveg, df$child_mango,                     df$child_fruit)   df$vege_fruit <- get_dummy(var_list = vege_fruit)   zvf <- get_zvf(df$vege_fruit, df$calc_age_months)

what: Utilities for Calculating Infant and Young Child Feeding Indicators — riycf
title: Utilities for Calculating Infant and Young Child Feeding Indicators — riycf
text: first 1,000 days life (pregnancy child’s 2nd birthday) critical addressing childhood malnutrition, especially stunting. Infant young child feeding practices (IYCF) largely overlap period cover breastfeeding complementary feeding practices first two years child’s life. also significant impact childhood health, nutrition outcomes, child survival. , therefore, critical countries measure IYCF practices part efforts monitor progress toward Sustainable Development Goal 2. also important development agencies able monitor evaluate programs aimed improving infant young child feeding practices towards improved overall childhood nutrition.

title: Utilities for Calculating Infant and Young Child Feeding Indicators — riycf
text: UNICEF released first IYCF indicators definition measurement guidelines 2008. 2021, guidelines updated along revised standard questionnaire capture information required calculate updated IYCF indicators since first initial publication. general, IYCF indicators can categorized three main categories: (1) breastfeeding indicators, (2) complementary indicators, (3) indicators, focused bottle-feeding practices generation data visualization plots breastfeeding status age.
